2.text: (The fog in your mind’s eye clears away, as does the cotton from your ears.)

3.text: (At once, your attention finds a focal point in the maid, who takes your lack of response as a cue to repeat her words.)

4.text: Good morning, my lady. I’m here to help you get dressed today or, if you’d like, I can leave it up to your discretion.

5.text: (Her head is bowed, though you notice her eyes peeking up at you nervously.)

6.text: (Even her tone makes it sound like she’s walking on eggshells, as though whoever this body once belonged to had a habit of berating her. Could this have something to do with what that god said?)

9.text: (You open your mouth, a response budding at the tip of your tongue.)

10.options: I'd appreciate your assistance.,I'd prefer to get dressed on my own.

13.text: (It’s a testament to her experience and skill, the way she performs her job in a flurry of fabrics and ribbons. The dress she’s selected fits perfectly on your body—deep and richly colored, tailored to fit whoever you’re meant to be.)

14.text: (Before you know it, she’s settled you at the vanity, selecting from the array of products lining its drawers without hesitation.)

15.text: (You close your eyes, waiting for her light touch to dissipate. Finally, after an eternity of brushes and powder puffs, she’s done.)

16.text: Will that be all this morning?

17.text: Yes, thank you. You are dismissed.

18.text: (She dips her head and gives a slight bow before she exits the room.)

19.text: (You turn to the vanity to see what your reflection looks like, only to be greeted with a thick, heavy cloth that enshrouds it entirely.)

21.text: (You wonder, for a moment, whether you should unveil it.)

22.options: Tug the fabric off.,Leave it on.

23.text: (Upon closer inspection, you can see a ring of nails affixing the fabric firmly across the vanity mirror.)

25.text: (You make a mental note to investigate further later. Your eyes sweep across the rest of the room, wondering what to do next.)

26.text: (You know so little about this world, this “villainess.” If you’re going to be here playing her role, you should know more about what exactly that role is, right?)

27.text: (In that case, you’ll have to take a closer look around this room.)

28.text: (You leave the fabric well alone, as you take a deep breath and rise to your feet. Your eyes sweep across the rest of the room, wondering what to do next.)

29.text: (You know so little about this world, this “villainess.” If you’re going to be here playing her role, you should know more about what exactly that role is, right?)

30.text: (In that case, you’ll have to take a closer look around this room.)

32.text: (She dips her head politely and leaves the room after that.)

33.text: (Silence is all that remains for a moment as you gaze at your surroundings.)

34.text: (Getting dressed does seem to be the priority, so you resolve yourself to wander to the wardrobe first. As you open it up, you find countless dresses neatly hanging one after the other.)

35.text: (For the most part they’re all elegant, detailed, and dark in color. They definitely fit the mental image that comes to mind when you think of “villainess.”)

36.text: (As you sort through them all, though, you can see a couple outliers from the bunch.)

37.text: (You take inventory of your options for a moment, committing the dresses to memory. Whether good or bad, there’s little variation in the dresses. At least the decision is rather easy, when all of them look the same.)

38.text: (It does take a bit of effort puzzling through how to get dressed, but you manage to get it done on your own without needing help.)

39.text: (Having finally dressed, you take a step back. Your eyes sweep across the rest of the room, as you wonder what to do next. You know so little about this world, this villainess. If you’re going to be here playing her role, you should know more about what exactly that role is, right?)

40.text: (In that case, you’ll have to take a closer look around this room.)

41.text: (The files look almost haphazardly tossed about— at least until you look closer.)

42.text: (You’re almost certain there’s a sort of organizational pattern, with the way the stacks are formed so neatly against each other. There’s got to be something more to this, but you just can’t figure out what exactly that pattern is yet.)

43.text: (In a sense, you feel like whoever had this desk before organized it in a way only they could understand.)

45.options: This desk is under new management; better to make it fit that.,I'm only changing what I need out of necessity.

46.text: (They’re thick and heavy to the touch, almost hard to budge as you pull them aside.)

47.options: I should replace the curtains.,I'll keep the curtains.

48.options: It'll be more my style that way.,It'll be easier to get in bed this way.

49.options: It would be a lot of work to pick out new ones anyways.,It feels wrong messing with someone else's bed... even if I'm them now.

50.options: Try to get a closer look.,Leave the books alone.

51.text: (When you check the last row, however, the spines don’t line up as neatly. In particular, you can see the worn cover of a book on…flower language?)

52.text: (As you reach for the book and flip it open, countless notes crammed into the margins assault your eyes until you take a moment to slowly examine the writing.)

53.text: (It seems to be in some sort of shorthand code, neat but ultimately incomprehensible to you.)

54.text: (Strange. You put the book back and return to the bedroom. Maybe with some more time you’ll be able to parse out what it says.)

55.text: (When you open the drawers you find countless more makeup products and boxes of jewelry arranged within.)

56.text: (A quick perusal of the options reveals a strong favoring of dark colored eye makeup and lipsticks. A couple unopened products are lighter in color, but ultimately untouched.)

57.text: (As for the contents of this vanity, well…)

58.text: (...or not. A thick, heavy cloth enshrouds the mirror of the vanity completely, a ring of nails preventing you from making any redecoration choices.)

59.text: (As much as you’re curious about why, you should probably at least get some makeup on your face. Luckily though, you manage to puzzle out some powder and a bit of color on your eyelids without having a mirror at hand.)

61.text: (As for the contents of this vanity, well…)

62.options: Some brighter colors would be nice.,I'll just work with whatever seems to be used.

63.text: (More importantly, contained within are countless dresses and gowns, each looking more elegant and pricey than the last.)

64.text: (The colors, however, are all muted and dark despite their delicate embroidery. One such dress hangs on the inside of the wardrobe, complete with matching shoes and jewelry.)

65.text: (It takes you a moment to realize that the set must’ve been what the original owner of the body was planning to wear tomorrow.)

66.options: ...I'll wear that tomorrow then.,Not my style - I'll pick something new for tomorrow.

67.text: (As you step closer, you get a marvelous view of the back gardens.)

68.text: (Flowers blossom splendidly despite the gloomy sky that hangs above, no doubt well-tended to on a regular basis. It truly lends the room a quiet air of seclusion, hidden away from the rest of the household and world.)

69.options: The privacy is nice to have.,I wish I could see more of this place.,It doesn't matter much to me either way.

73.text: (Someone private, someone perhaps on the quieter side, not as willing to stand out. No bright colors, always shielded from the rest of the world. You can surmise only these little things about her, if they’re even true that is.)

74.text: (Maybe if you had the time, you’d have spent the rest of your day here, trying to figure out who this body was and who you’re meant to be now, whether it was following in her footsteps or stepping out onto your own path.)

75.text: (Maybe you’d have spent the rest of your life chasing that kind of mirage. But you didn’t, because there are always things to do. And you couldn’t spend your entire life sitting in a room learning the same old things again and again, so—you take your first step outside.)

maid.text: Yes, I would appreciate your assistance. Thank you.

tug.text: (You give it a small tug at first. But as you pull, it resists.)

leave.text: (Maybe it would be for the best not to mess with things you don’t know enough about. you can come back to this later.)

own.text: I believe I can manage this much on my own. You are dismissed.

explore.options: Explore the desk.,Explore the bed.,Explore the bookshelf.

desk.text: (The desk, at first glance, is strewn with paper piles, contents clashing without any rhyme or reason.)

reorganize_desk.text: (Regardless of whatever organization pattern its owner may have followed, what matters now is that you have no way of understanding it.)

leave_desk.text: (Yeah, it’s better to just leave it untouched.)

bed.text: (The fabric beneath your hands feels soft, silky, luxurious. It glides beneath your fingertips easily, as you run them through the sheets then the curtains of the canopy. The curtains are opaque, shielding the bed away from the bright rays of sunlight.)

replace_curtains.text: (They’re so troublesome to push aside—you might as well just get rid of them.)

keep_curtains.text: (Maybe it would be best to not do anything for now.)

bookshelf.text: (Laid out on wooden shelves are countless books of varying colors, thickly bound and sitting neatly side by side. Their titles range from history, politics, science, and literature, tightly packed away. The spines sit shoulder to shoulder, somehow perfectly matching heights.)

closer_look.text: (Upon closer inspection, you soon realize the books on the upper and middle shelves are packed too tightly, unable to be budged without tremendous effort. No doubt those are just for show.)

vanity.text: (The vanity sits unobtrusively against the wall nearest you, neatly maintained with only a few products sitting at the top, organized in a way that looks almost deliberately placed for show.)

vanity_maid.text: (You recognize the products the maid was using this morning, dark in color. And, of course, the vanity is still the same as before. Not a hint of your reflection can be seen past the fabric. Nothing’s changed in that regard.)

vanity_own.text: (Right, this would be a good chance to do your makeup.)

dresser.text: (You can tell the wardrobe is very finely crafted, with its carved detailing and dark wood.)

window.text: (The window is easily the most visible part of the room, stretching nearly from ceiling to floor. Pale light streams through, unimpeded by the drawn curtains.)

fake.text: (As you take in the rest of the room again, having now better familiarized yourself with your surroundings, you think that you have the burgeoning beginnings of a concept of who the original owner of this body must’ve been.)

explore_1.options: Explore the vanity.,Explore the dresser.,Explore the window.

scene_2.text: (As you take in the rest of the room again, having now better familiarized yourself with your surroundings, you think that you have the burgeoning beginnings of a concept of who the original owner of this body must’ve been.)
